describe: South Korea, officially known as the Republic of Korea, is a vibrant and technologically advanced country located on the southern half of the Korean Peninsula. Known for its rich cultural heritage, dynamic cities, and beautiful landscapes, South Korea offers a unique blend of traditional and modern attractions.

cities.name: üè∞ Seoul
cities.geographical_location: Located in the northwest part of South Korea, near the Han River.
cities.climate: Seoul experiences a humid continental climate with four distinct seasons, including hot summers and cold winters.

cities.name: üèù Busan
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the southeastern coast of South Korea, facing the Korea Strait.
cities.climate: Busan has a humid subtropical climate with mild winters and hot, humid summers.
cities.famous_cuisine: Seafood, Milmyeon (cold wheat noodles), and Dwaeji Gukbap (pork soup).

cities.name: üèù Jeju Island
cities.geographical_location: Located southwest of the Korean Peninsula, in the Korea Strait.
cities.climate: Jeju Island has a temperate climate with mild winters and warm summers.
cities.famous_cuisine: Jeonbokjuk (abalone porridge), Black Pork BBQ, and Hallabong (citrus fruit).
